duties_responsibilities.duty: Serve as the main contact and resource for ordering materials in subject and/or language-specific collection areas.
Receive and respond to high volume of order requests for print, electronic, and media resources in various languages.
Expertly search requests and place orders in the library system and vendor databases or online catalogs.
Handle special collections materials acquired in Western European languages, including rare books, manuscripts, photographs, and digital records.
Import or create brief bibliographic records in MARC record format.
Assist with e-resource lifecycle management and perform routine maintenance on order records.
Establish and maintain professional relationships with external service providers, including foreign and domestic vendors, publishers, and content providers.

Work closely with department units to solve complex problems in acquiring monograph, serial, database, e-book, e-journal, media, government document, map, special collection, out-of-print, and other unique library materials.

education_certification.credential: Two-year college degree plus three or more years of experience in an academic library, or equivalent combination of education and relevant experience. Proficiency in Cyrillic script and other Slavic languages.
